title: 578.03 WARRANT; SHERIFF TO TAKE POSSESSION OF PROPERTY; FEES AND COSTS.
text: The court may thereupon issue a warrant directed to the sheriff or a deputy, which may run throughout the state, commanding the officer to take possession of the property named in the schedule and hold it subject to the order of the court and make return of the warrant as soon as may be, with the officer's doings thereon and with a schedule of the property so taken. The officer shall post a copy of the warrant upon each parcel of land named in the schedule and cause so much of the warrant as relates to land to be recorded in the office of the county recorder for the county where the land is located. The officer shall receive such fees for serving the warrant as the court allows, but not more than those established by law for similar service upon a writ of attachment. If the petition is dismissed, the fees and the cost of publishing and serving the notice hereinafter provided shall be paid by the petitioner; if a receiver is appointed, they shall be paid by the receiver and allowed in the receiver's account.

variables.name: petition_status
variables.description: The current status of the petition, whether it is dismissed or active.

variables.name: receiver_appointed
variables.description: A boolean indicating whether a receiver has been appointed.

variables.name: fees_payer
variables.description: The party responsible for paying the fees.

variables.name: costs_payer
variables.description: The party responsible for paying the costs of publishing and serving the notice.

consequences: If the petition is dismissed, the petitioner pays the fees and costs.
If a receiver is appointed, the receiver pays the fees and costs.

variables.name: warrant_issued
variables.description: A boolean indicating whether the warrant has been issued.

variables.name: warrant_posted
variables.description: A boolean indicating whether the warrant has been posted on each parcel of land.

variables.name: warrant_recorded
variables.description: A boolean indicating whether the warrant has been recorded in the county recorder's office.

variables.name: fees_allowed
variables.description: The fees allowed by the court for serving the warrant.

variables.name: max_fees
variables.description: The maximum fees established by law for similar service upon a writ of attachment.

consequences: The warrant is valid and properly executed.
The fees for serving the warrant are within legal limits.
